ABOUT_DESC:
My name is Jeferson Barrero, but my friends call me Jef. I started programming at the age of 14 as a self-taught enthusiast, inspired by figures like Freddy Vegas and by exploring the web. This early dive into the fascinating world of programming shaped my journey.

As a PLATZI student and a participant in the 'MisiónTIC2022' project since its pilot phase, backed by the Colombian government and MINTIC, I have built a solid foundation in programming and web development. Actively participating in personal and collaborative projects with clients has been essential to honing my skills as a developer.

Adding to this journey with virtual courses from SENA and my current studies in 3D modeling for industry and administrative assistance, I aim to stand out in the field of web development and programming. My vision includes not only personal growth but also actively contributing to the community. As a contributor on GitHub, I participate in projects aimed at promoting free and open programming education.

EXPERIENCE.TITLE: MisionTIC2022
EXPERIENCE.DESCRIPTION:
My participation in Misión TIC 2022, since its pilot phase in August 2020, was characterized by comprehensive training in web projects with a specific focus on Node.js. Actively collaborating with young individuals from across the country on joint projects not only expanded my technical skills but also provided a valuable experience of nationwide teamwork.

Complementary activities, such as professional talks and the visit to the Entrepreneurs' Park, added significant value to my education. The talks offered enriching perspectives and practical advice, while the park visit provided a tangible insight into the technological needs of the country. These complementary elements enhanced my overall understanding and offered a deeper vision of the practical application of technology in the national context.
